column6: 2.8V or 3.3V in case we have some issues with the data line. Install 3.3V (https://eu.mouser.com/ProductDetail/Microchip-Technology/TC1108-3.3VDBTR?qs=AIv3GLl6KMNgHSi6BcHPMA%3D%3D)
Power Supply for the IC LEDs. It is configured to 5V, but we can reduced to 4.2V if we need to improve the LED response in the data line
Charging IC. Limited to 500mA -> probably it will drain the battery if connected and ON. We should experiment with lower R21 (to 1,5 oer 1,8k) to increase the current.
JP1 -> reset the microcontroller. JP2 -> It turns ON the display even if the circuitry of Q3 does not work.

column8: Green: battery is charged. Red: Battery is charging.

column6: By default they are SMMBT5551LT1G, but those only supports 600mA. For Q3 we need more current. Buy the mouser nr 771-PBSS4120T215. You can place it for all Qs or only for Q3. https://eu.mouser.com/ProductDetail/Nexperia/PBSS4120T215?qs=LOCUfHb8d9syLy2%252BT0L8uQ%3D%3D

column1: Then, if the Vdisplay is 4.5V, the data line should be from 0 to 3,15V min, which complies with a IC2 of 3.3V
If R27 and R28 are 82K and 27K, the voltage is 5V, and the data line should be 3.5V (Higher than expected)
